content: dk treasures simple ribbed socks a top down knitted sock pattern by christine long derks the treasuregoddess yarn 1-2 skeins of silken purls dk yarn 50% silk 50% superwash merino wool 100 grams 211 meters 231 yards or 1-2 skeins of dk treasures yarn 100% superwash merino wool 100 grams 250 meters 274 yards adult small sizes take one skein medium to large sizes take two skeins colorway shown is king s cloak on silken purls dk yarn available at http //www treasuregoddess com needles/notions set of 4 double pointed needles size us 4 3 5 mm or whichever size gives you gauge or long circular needle in size us 4 if you use magic loop method darning needle to weave in ends one stitch marker if desired i usually just use the cast on tail to tell me where my round began gauge approximately 6 stitches/inch in stockinette stitch gauge is not too important for this project just know that if your gauge is significantly different you may need additional yarn finished size adult small to large 7-9 5 circumference slightly stretched this design is very stretchy and fits a wide variety of thicknesses of legs/feet the small to large sizing will come by adjusting length of cuff or foot this is a my go-to pattern for socks that fit everyone the 3x1 r ibbing stretches so well it fits all widths of feet it also looks amazing in wild hand painted colorways silk blend yarns work great for bed socks and 100% super www treasuregoddess com wash merino wool works for boot socks abbreviations k = knit p = purl k2tog = knit 2 stitches together decreases 1 stitch ssk = slip slip knit slip 1 knitwise slip 1 knitwise knit those 2 stitches together through the back loops decreases 1 stitch make 1 = insert left needle from front to back into horizontal strand between stitches knit stitch through back loop increases 1 stitch rs = right side side facing out when worn ws = wrong side side of work facing towards foot/leg when worn dk treasures simple ribbed sock directions cuff cast on 48 stitches loosely join being careful not to twist stitches divide stitches evenly across 3 double pointed needles place stitch marker for beginning of round if used round 1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round repeat round 1 for a total of 8 rounds leg round 1 *k3 purl 1 repeat from * to end of round repeat round 1 until sock measures 7 inches from cast on edge or to desired length before beginning heel stop earlier for smaller sizes create heel flap divide the stitches as follows across 3 double pointed needles  needle 1 24 stitches you will be working back and forth on needle 1 to create heel flap  needles 2 and 3 12 stitches each these will just hang out until we need them later row 1 rs *slip 1 purlwise k1 repeat from
